election_record.label: Vermont 1816 Governor

overview.note: The Official Election Results tally sheet lists 13,888 votes for Samuel Strong; however, the county totals add up to 13,956.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1816, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 18, North Star (Danville, VT), October 19, The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), October 21, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 23, and The Christian Herald (Middlebury, VT), October 23, report 13,888 votes for Samuel Strong.

The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), September 10: "The Election. The following are all the returns we have received. They are sufficient, however, to convince us that, if federalists in other parts of the State have been as negligent as they have in this, the election has resulted in the complete success of the democratic ticket for State Officers and Members of Congress, and in an accession to the strength of democracy in the House of Representatives. 'So mote it be' When Sampson, confiding in his strength, carelessly slept in the lap of his Delilah, the grinning barber, like many of our democratic shavers, laughed at the prospect of his being delivered into the hands of the Philistines."

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 13, reports 31 votes for Samuel Strong in Addison.

sub_unit.name: Bridport
sub_unit.note: The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 13, reports 145 votes for Jonas Galusha in Bridport.

sub_unit.name: Cornwall
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Mirror (Middlebury, VT), September 11, reports 111 votes for Samuel Strong in Cornwall.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: Hancock Town Records lists 13 votes for Samuel Strong.

sub_unit.name: Middlebury
sub_unit.note: The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), September 10, reports 170 votes for Samuel Strong in Middlebury.

sub_unit.note: The Vermont Mirror (Middlebury, VT), September 11, reports 135 votes for Samuel Strong in Monkton.

sub_unit.note: The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 13, reports 191 votes for Jonas Galusha and 31 votes for Samuel Strong in Rupert.

sub_unit.name: Stamford
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, reports 36 votes for Samuel Strong in Stamford.

sub_unit.note: The Burke Town Records, North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, and The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 20, report 55 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Groton
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, reports a majority of 16 votes for Samuel Strong in Groton.

sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, and The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 20, report 84 votes for Samuel Strong in Saint Johnsbury.

sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, and The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 20, report 64 votes for Jonas Galusha in Sutton.

sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), October 21, reports 151 votes for Samuel Strong in Essex County.

sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, reports 58 votes for Samuel Strong in Cambridge.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Official Election Results tally sheet lists the 51 votes for Martin Chittenden as being for Samuel Strong.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1816, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 18, North Star (Danville, VT), October 19, The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), October 21, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 23, and The Christian Herald (Middlebury, VT), October 23, report 1334 votes for Samuel Strong in Orange County.

sub_unit.note: The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), September 10, and North Star (Danville, VT) report 53 votes for Samuel Strong in Orange.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Jonas Galusha with 2597 votes but the town totals add up to 2576.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1816, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 18, North Star (Danville, VT), October 19, The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), October 21, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 23, and The Christian Herald (Middlebury, VT), October 23, report 1476 votes for Samuel Strong in Rutland County.

sub_unit.name: Mount Tabor
sub_unit.note: The votes from Mount Tabor were rejected.

sub_unit.note: The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 13, and North Star (Danville, VT), September 21, report 47 votes for Jonas Galusha in Pittsfield.

sub_unit.name: Townshend
sub_unit.note: Collections Relating to the History and Inhabitants of the Town of Townshend, Vermont, lists 28 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Samuel Strong with 1385 votes but the town totals add up to 1485.

The Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1816, The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 18, North Star (Danville, VT), October 19, The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), October 21, The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 23, and The Christian Herald (Middlebury, VT), October 23, report 1385 votes for Samuel Strong in Windsor County.

sub_unit.name: Baltimore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Baltimore.

sub_unit.name: Bridgewater
sub_unit.note: The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) (Danville), September 13, reports 92 votes for Jonas Galusha and 41 votes for Samuel Strong in Bridgewater.

election_record.reference: Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1816. 208-215.
Fairbanks, Edward Taylor. The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Cowles Press, 1914. 571.
Phelps, James Houghton. Collections Relating to the History and Inhabitants of the Town of Townshend, Vermont. Townshend, VT: G.E. Selleck, 1877. 229.
Wells, Frederick P. History of Newbury, Vermont. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Caledonian, 1902. 357.
